_header: Jesu that all this world has wroght
Subjects: Passion, meditations on; Christ, Passion of
_description: A Meditation on the Passion — eight 8-line stanzas with refrain: ‘ffor þus þou sched þi blood for me’

BLHar1706.First Lines: Ihesu þat alle þis worlde haste wrouȝteAnd of a cleene virgyn so tokeste oure kynde…
BLHar1706.Last Lines: …If y fourȝate þe vnkynd y wereffor vij tymes þi blood þou schede for me
BLHar1706.Attributed Title: As clerkes seyne and specyally Seynt Anselme þere were vppon þe blessed and moste gloryouse body of oure lorde ihesu cryste open woundes by nombre v. þousand iiij hundred seuenty and fyue Howe oure lorde ihesu seuene tymes bleed for vs (rubric preceding first line, f. 210)
BLHar1706.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 1706.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_1706.

Longleat30.First Lines:
IHesu þat hast al þis world I wroughtAnd of a clene
                    virgyn so take oure kynde…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…If I forgate þe ful vnkynde I wereffor vij tymes þi
                    bloode þou sched for me

HunHM142.First Lines:
IHesu that all this worlde hast wroghteAnd of a clene virgyn so
                    take oure kyndeAnd with thi blode oure soules hast boughteMy loue to
                    þe I pray þe to bynde…
HunHM142.Last Lines:
…If I forgate þe ful vnkynde I wereffor vii tymes þi
                    blode þou sched for me
HunHM142.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 133-5.
